content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-198-07-B
|Item_parent=Microcrystalline arthropathies
|Item_parent_short=Microcrystalline arthropathies
|Rank=B
|Intitle=Knowing the prevalence of gout in France
|Description=Larger than that of common inflammatory rheumatic diseases (RA, Rpso, SPA): 0.9%.
|Rubric=Epidemiology
|Contributors=
|Order=7}}
The prevalence of gout in adults in France is 0.9%.

It is therefore the most common intermittent inflammatory rheumatic disease in industrialised countries.

question.title: What is the prevalence of gout in adults in France?
question.description: The prevalence of gout in adults in France is 0.9%.

option_a.description: The prevalence of gout in adults in France is 0.8%.

option_b.description: The prevalence of gout in adults in France is 0.9%.

option_c.description: The prevalence of gout in adults in France is 1.1%.

option_d.description: The prevalence of gout in adults in France is 1.2%.

correct_option.description: The prevalence of gout in adults in France is 0.9%.
